title: Windows: Error combining Jaxb and Apache Camel
body:
### Describe the bug

When combining `quarkus-jaxb` and Apache-Camel-extensions the build process fails with error message `java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org/apache/camel/model.AggregateDefinition` when running on Windows.

I guess the bug was introduced with PR https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/13408 or issue https://github.com/quarkiverse/quarkus-cxf/issues/58, respectively. I suggest replacing `/` **and** `\` for dots in file paths.

To reproduce, simply depend on `org.apache.camel.quarkus:camel-quarkus-xml-jaxb` and build via Windows maven. Note, that I linked to a reproducer project in the reproduce section.

### Expected behavior

Successful build

### Actual behavior

Build fails with `ClassNotFoundException`

### How to Reproduce?

Checkout https://github.com/fwippe/quarkus-jaxb-camel-bug and run `.\mvnw.cmd package`.

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19042.1348]

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "11.0.3" 2019-04-16 OpenJDK Runtime Environment AdoptOpenJDK (build 11.0.3+7) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM AdoptOpenJDK (build 11.0.3+7, mixed mode)

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.5.3.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.8.1 (05c21c65bdfed0f71a2f2ada8b84da59348c4c5d) Maven home: ... Java version: 11.0.3, vendor: AdoptOpenJDK, runtime: ... Default locale: de_DE, platform encoding: Cp1252 OS name: "windows 10", version: "10.0", arch: "amd64", family: "windows"

### Additional information

_No response_
